<!-- Area/postal codes & others --> |postal_code_type = [[ZIP code]]s |postal_code = 91390 |area_code = [[area code 661|661]] |blank_name = [[Geographic Names Information System|GNIS]] feature IDs |blank_info = 1660235; 2582928 |website = |footnotes = {{gnis|1660235}}; {{gnis|2582928}} }} '''Agua Dulce''' ([[Spanish language|Spanish]] for ''[[freshwater]]'', literally ''sweet water'') is a [[census-designated place]]<ref>{{gnis|2582928}}</ref> located in [[Los Angeles County, California|Los Angeles County]], [[California]].<ref name=gnis /> It lies at an elevation of 2,526 feet (770 m).<ref name=gnis /> Agua Dulce is located just north of [[Santa Clarita, California|Santa Clarita]]. The town has a population of about 4,000. It is located at {{coord|34|29|47|N|118|19|32|W}} and covers a geographic area of about {{convert|25|sqmi|km2}}. The [[ZIP code]] is 91390 and [[area code 661]].
== Geography == Agua Dulce is located about 25 miles (40 km) Southwest of [[Palmdale, California|Palmdale]], 44 miles (71 km) North of [[Los Angeles, California|Los Angeles]], in the [[Sierra Pelona Valley]] portion of Southern [[California]].
== Economics == The town has a median household income of $78,000 (US).{{Citation needed|date=June 2011}} The average household size is 3.1.{{Citation needed|date=June 2011}}
==Demographics== The [[2010 United States Census]]<ref>{{USCensus-2010CA}}</ref> reported that Agua Dulce had a population of 3,342. The [[population density]] was 146.3 people per square mile (56.5/kmÂ²). The racial makeup of Agua Dulce was 2,854 (85.4%) [[White (U.S. Census)|White]], 59 (1.8%) [[African American (U.S. Census)|African American]], 24 (0.7%) [[Native American (U.S. Census)|Native American]], 78 (2.3%) [[Asian (U.S. Census)|Asian]], 3 (0.1%) [[Pacific Islander (U.S. Census)|Pacific Islander]], 223 (6.7%) from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 101 (3.0%) from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Latino (U.S. Census)|Latino]] of any race were 611 persons (18.3%).
The Census reported that 3,314 people (99.2% of the population) lived in households, 28 (0.8%) lived in non-institutionalized group quarters, and 0 (0%) were institutionalized.
There were 1,201 households, out of which 355 (29.6%) had children under the age of 18 living in them, 795 (66.2%) were [[marriage|opposite-sex married couples]] living together, 72 (6.0%) had a female householder with no husband present, 58 (4.8%) had a male householder with no wife present. There were 64 (5.3%) [[POSSLQ|unmarried opposite-sex partnerships]], and 10 (0.8%) [[same-sex partnerships|same-sex married couples or partnerships]]. 200 households (16.7%) were made up of individuals and 73 (6.1%) had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.76. There were 925 [[family (U.S. Census)|families]] (77.0% of all households); the average family size was 3.06.
The population was spread out with 645 people (19.3%) under the age of 18, 310 people (9.3%) aged 18 to 24, 588 people (17.6%) aged 25 to 44, 1,336 people (40.0%) aged 45 to 64, and 463 people (13.9%) who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 47.3 years. For every 100 females there were 101.7 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 102.0 males.
There were 1,277 housing units at an average density of 55.9 per square mile (21.6/kmÂ²), of which 1,058 (88.1%) were owner-occupied, and 143 (11.9%) were occupied by renters. The homeowner vacancy rate was 1.2%; the rental vacancy rate was 3.4%. 2,929 people (87.6% of the population) lived in owner-occupied housing units and 385 people (11.5%) lived in rental housing units.
== About Agua Dulce == Vasquez Rocks has been long used as a popular filming location by the [[Hollywood]] movie industry, most notably ''[[The Flintstones (film)|The Flintstones]]'' movie, [[Mel Brooks]]' [[Blazing Saddles]], and the ''[[Star Trek: The Original Series|Star Trek]]'' episode "[[Arena (Star Trek: The Original Series)|Arena]]." The 1971 movie ''[[Duel (1971 film)|Duel]]'' filmed extensively in the area. The History channel shoots the popular reality TV show "Top Shot" in the hills and canyons on the north side of the valley.
Vasquez Rocks got its name from the famous bandit [[Tiburcio VÃ¡squez]] who used to run and hide there while being looked for.
Agua Dulce is home to the Agua Dulce Vineyards,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aguadulcevineyards.com/ |title=Agua Dulce Vineyards/wine tasting/gift shop/winery/los angeles |publisher=Aguadulcevineyards.com |date=2010-04-04 |accessdate=2010-10-04}}</ref> the largest [[winery]] in Los Angeles County.
Agua Dulce also has a [[general aviation]] airport known as [[Agua Dulce Airpark]]. The Airpark and surrounding area was the location for the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] game show [[101 Ways to Leave a Gameshow]] which premiered on June 21st, 2011.
== Filmography== In the movie ''[[Rat Race (film)|Rat Race]]'', the scene prior to [[Whoopi Goldberg]]'s car plunging into a junk yard was filmed on Agua Dulce Canyon Road.
The western film ''[[More Dead Than Alive]]'' was entirely shot at Agua Dulce.<ref>http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0064695/locations</ref>
The 1971 made for T.V. movie ''[[Duel (1971 film)|Duel]]'' was filmed in and around Agua Dulce.
The Film ''[[Star Trek Generations]]'' filmed its climactic scene in and around [[Vasquez Rocks]].
''[[Bill and Ted's Bogus Journey]]'' was filmed here.
The entirety of [[Mel Brooks]]' 1974 film [[Blazing Saddles]] was filmed in Agua Dulce and neighboring [[Acton, California]]. <ref>{{http://books.google.com/books?id=XmISfb1C3VEC&lpg=PA116&ots=Sxd2DaWz7C&dq=blazing%20saddles%2C%20agua%20dulce&pg=PA116#v=onepage&q=blazing%20saddles,%20agua%20dulce&f=false}}</ref>
The films ''[[127 Hours]]'', ''The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle'' and various [[Nike, Inc.|Nike]] commercials were also set in Agua Dulce locations.
The [[History (TV channel)|History Channel]] show ''[[Top Shot]]'', season 3 was filmed in Agua Dulce in April & May 2011.
==Education== Acton-Agua Dulce Unified School District:<ref>{{cite web|url=http://aadusd.k12.ca.us/ |title=Acton-Agua Dulce Unified School District |publisher=Aadusd.k12.ca.us |date= |accessdate=2010-10-04}}</ref> *Vasquez High School, Acton<ref>http://aadusd.k12.ca.us/vhs/default.htm</ref> *High Desert Middle School, Acton<ref>{{cite web|url=http://aadusd.k12.ca.us/hds/default.htm |title=High Desert School |publisher=Aadusd.k12.ca.us |date= |accessdate=2010-10-04}}</ref> *Meadowlark Elementary School, Acton<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aadusd.k12.ca.us/mes/ |title=Meadowlark Elementary School |publisher=Aadusd.k12.ca.us |date= |accessdate=2011-11-06}}</ref> *Agua Dulce Elementary School, Agua Dulce<ref>{{cite web|url=http://aadusd.k12.ca.us/ades/default.htm |title=Agua Dulce Elementary School |publisher=Aadusd.k12.ca.us |date= |accessdate=2010-10-04}}</ref>
